pros: Helping people, flexible hours, good benefits

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Oak Ridge, TN
pros: Depending on what program you work in it could be good.  Co-workers and most management are very nice and fun to work around.  Upper management is accessible and there is a “small family” friendly feel to the place.
cons: Pay is horrible which causes staff turnover to be high (look on any given day how many jobs are available and that’s not because they are expanding).  Always short staffed in some area.  Maybe a good place to get your feet wet right out of school but couldn’t imagine a career there. If you want to make more money you’d have to go into being a manager/supervisor but that means you stop doing the one thing you went there to do if you’re in the mental health field.  Worked there over 5 years and only got a few standard of living raises of maybe 2% (and the Christmas bonus of a $25 Walmart gift card is always a joke to everyone).

review_title: Excellent Management and Great group to work with
job_title: PSR Vocational Specialist in Clinton, TN
pros: Great opportunities, Great clients and co-workers, yearly trip to Nashville for event was always fun and the interactions you got daily were good.
cons: Pay increase would been great. Considering all the extras that are and need to be done, it might make more jump onto getting more accomplished.
None to mention at this time.
